instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 no power
threads.message:
hello Guys,
so i have here an Macbook pro 2019, it does not power on but the trackpad can be clicked one time not with force touch but just soft click.

it takes 20.1V and 0.14A from the charger the board looks like new there is no any corrosion,these are the measurements i have done

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>= 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>=1.8V

<SIGNAL>PPVDDCPU_AWAKE</SIGNAL>= 0.75V

<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL> 1.2V

<SIGNAL>PMU_SYS_ALIVE</SIGNAL>= 1.78V

<SIGNAL>PMU_COLD_RESET_L</SIGNAL>= 1.79V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 no power
threads.message:
If all SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages are present, see what happens in DFU mode.
Try Revive option first; it will not erase SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 no power
threads.message:
Is it possible to to it without an additional macbook? I have only windows pc.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 no power
threads.message: You need another MacBook, with Apple Configurator 2 installed.
